technology_decisions.description: Which AI service to use for analyzing code and generating suggestions

options.name: Anthropic Claude
options.description: Claude 3.5 Sonnet - Anthropic's flagship model with excellent code understanding
pros: Excellent at code analysis and reasoning
Good balance of speed and quality
trade_offs: Slightly slower than GPT-4 Turbo but more thorough
options.recommendation_reason: Best-in-class for code understanding and clear explanations

options.name: OpenAI GPT-4
options.description: OpenAI's GPT-4 Turbo model for code analysis
trade_offs: Faster but sometimes less thorough than Claude

options.name: Self-hosted CodeLlama
options.description: Meta's open-source code-specialized LLM running on own infrastructure
pros: Full control over model and data
trade_offs: Lower cost at scale but higher upfront investment

technology_decisions.user_choice_description: Claude 3.5 Sonnet - Anthropic's flagship model with excellent code understanding
technology_decisions.user_reason: Best quality for code analysis and clear, educational explanations

technology_decisions.description: Which code editor to embed for syntax highlighting and code input

options.name: Monaco Editor
options.description: The editor that powers VS Code, available as a standalone component
pros: Industry standard - same editor as VS Code
Excellent syntax highlighting for all major languages
options.recommendation_reason: Industry standard, familiar UX, excellent language support

options.name: CodeMirror 6
options.description: Modern, modular code editor for the browser
pros: Highly modular - include only what you need
cons: Less familiar to VS Code users
trade_offs: Smaller bundle but less out-of-box features
More flexible but requires more setup

technology_decisions.user_choice_description: The editor that powers VS Code, available as a standalone component
technology_decisions.user_reason: Developers are already familiar with VS Code, reduces learning curve

technology_decisions.description: Component for displaying before/after code comparisons when previewing fixes

options.name: react-diff-viewer-continued
options.description: Clean React component for displaying diffs with split or unified views
trade_offs: Easy to use but fewer features
options.recommendation_reason: Simple API, good enough for our use case, easy to style

options.name: Monaco Diff Editor
options.description: Built-in diff capability in Monaco Editor
cons: More complex to set up for modal use
trade_offs: No new dependency but harder to implement

technology_decisions.user_choice_description: Clean React component for displaying diffs with split or unified views
technology_decisions.user_reason: Simpler implementation, good enough for fix previews

summary.estimated_learning_curve: Low - all chosen technologies are well-documented
